lines.content: * The main class for the Harry task manager application.
* Constructs a Harry instance, initializing UI, storage, and task list.
* Runs the main execution loop for handling user commands.
* The main entry point of the application.
* Represents a command to add a task to the task list.
* Constructs an AddCommand with the specified task.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Executes the add task command by adding the task to the task list,
* displaying a confirmation message, and saving the updated task list.
* @param tasks   The task list to which the task will be added.
* @param ui      The UI component to show messages.
* @param storage The storage component to save the task list.
* @throws HarryException If an error occurs during saving.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws HarryException {
* Represents an abstract command that can be executed.
* Executes the command with the given task list, UI, and storage components.
* @param tasks   The task list to modify.
* @param ui      The UI component to display messages.
* @param storage The storage component to save changes.
* @throws HarryException If an error occurs during execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws HarryException;
* Determines whether this command is an exit command.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified task index.
* @param index The index of the task to be deleted.
* Executes the delete command by removing the task from the list
* and saving the updated task list.
* @throws HarryException If the index is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws HarryException {
* Represents a command to exit the application.
* Executes the exit command by displaying an exit message.
* @param tasks   The task list (not used in this command).
* @param ui      The UI instance to display messages.
* @param storage The storage instance (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Indicates that this command is an exit command.
* @return true, since this command signifies exiting the application.
* Command to find and display tasks that match a specific date.
* This command filters tasks based on their associated date and shows them to the user.

* Executes the command to find tasks by the specified date.

* @param tasks   The TaskList containing all tasks.
* @param ui      The user interface object used to show messages to the user.
* @param storage The storage object used to interact with saved data (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Oops! No events found on " + date);

* Represents a task with a deadline.
private static final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HHmm");

* Returns a string representation of the Event task.
